articles.title: DJI couldn’t confirm or deny it disguised this drone to evade a US ban
articles.description: DJI barely sells drones in the United States anymore. The shelves are bare; resellers are jacking up prices. It appears an unofficial ban at US customs is to blame. But on Amazon, you can now buy a drone that's a a dead ringer for the DJI Mini 4 Pro - the SkyRover X1 - for […]
articles.author: Sean Hollister

articles.title: Isambard-AI, the UK’s Most Powerful AI Supercomputer, Goes Live
articles.description: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.
articles.author: Brian Caulfield

articles.title: A satellite just used AI to make its own decisions in space — and NASA’s stoked
articles.description: For the first time, a satellite has used onboard AI to autonomously decide where and when to capture a scientific image — all in under 90 seconds, with no human input. The technology, called Dynamic Targeting, was tested by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) earlier this month. It was installed aboard a briefcase-sized satellite built and operated by UK-based startup Open Cosmos, and carried a machine learning processor developed by Dublin-based firm Ubotica. In the test, the satellite...
articles.author: Siôn Geschwindt
articles.content: For the first time, a satellite has used onboard AI to autonomously decide where and when to capture a scientific image — all in under 90 seconds, with no human input. articles.title: PEP 799: A dedicated ``profilers`` package for organizing Python profiling tools
articles.description: This PEP proposes the creation of a new standard library module named profilers to organize Python’s built-in profiling tools under a single, coherent namespace.
articles.content: This PEP proposes the creation of a new standard library module named profilers to organize Python’s built-in profiling tools under a single, coherent namespace.

articles.title: ESA spaceplane project revives bankrupt firm’s hypersonic engine
articles.description: A bankrupt company’s propulsion system for hypersonic planes is being revived by Invictus, a new European Space Agency (ESA)-backed project aiming to build and fly a hydrogen-powered spaceplane by 2031. The proposed engine for the plane is based on so-called pre-cooler technology, developed over decades by UK aerospace firm Reaction Engines, which went bust in November. Many of Reaction Engines’ top engineers found a new home at British aerospace and defence company Frazer-Nash Consultancy,...
articles.author: Siôn Geschwindt
articles.content: A bankrupt company’s propulsion system for hypersonic planes is being revived by Invictus, a new European Space Agency (ESA)-backed project aiming to build and fly a hydrogen-powered spaceplane by 2031. The proposed engine for the plane is based on so-called pre-cooler technology, developed over decades by UK aerospace firm Reaction Engines, which went bust in November. articles.title: Day in the life of an SOC leader
articles.description: A security operations center (SOC) leader is the point person for an organization’s security operations. They run a team of security analysts, engineers, and other specialists. But what exactly do they do on a day-to-day basis?As the person managing the organization’s cybersecurity hub, the SOC leader has to navigate all the complexities that come with it. An effective SOC leader (also known as an SOC manager or security operations lead) balances strategy, technology, and team leadership...
articles.author: Elastic Security Team
articles.content: A security operations center (SOC) leader is the point person for an organization’s security operations. They run a team of security analysts, engineers, and other specialists. articles.title: The Search for Stability: Learning Dynamics of Strategic Publishers with Initial Documents
articles.description: We study a game-theoretic information retrieval model in which strategic publishers aim to maximize their chances of being ranked first by the search engine while maintaining the integrity of their original documents. We show that the commonly used Probability Ranking Principle (PRP) ranking scheme results in an unstable environment where games often fail to reach pure Nash equilibrium. We propose two families of ranking functions that do not adhere to the PRP. We provide both theoretical and...
articles.author: Omer Madmon, Idan Pipano, Itamar Reinman, Moshe Tennenholtz
articles.content: We study a game-theoretic information retrieval model in which strategic publishers aim to maximize their chances of being ranked first by the search engine while maintaining the integrity of their original documents. We show that the commonly used Probability Ranking Principle (PRP) ranking scheme results in an unstable environment where games often fail to reach pure Nash equilibrium. We propose two families of ranking functions that do not adhere to the PRP. We provide both theoretical and...
